info.title: Trackabi Public API
info.description: This documentation provides a guide to using our API, designed to help developers integrate, manage, and scale their applications with ease. Whether you're building a new product or enhancing an existing system, this API offers secure and flexible endpoints for accessing core features and data. Inside, you'll find clear instructions, sample requests, and best practices to support smooth integration and efficient development. To use the API, an API key is required. It can be generated in your personal settings under the API Keys section.

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of clients for a specified company account. The resulting list depends on the access permissions of the user who owns the API key used.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sorts results by a specified field. Some data may be unavailable due to API key access restrictions (e.g., 'currency', 'hourly_rate').

get.description: Retrieves the details of a specific client by ID.

short_name.description: The short name of the client

contact_person.description: The contact person for the client

currency.description: The currency used by the client (access-restricted)

put.description: Updates details of a specific client by ID.

delete.description: Deletes a specified client from the organization.

post.description: Creates a new client in the organization.

id.description: The ID of the created client.

get.summary: Get active time types in a company

short_name.description: Short name of the time type

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sort results by a specified field. Some data may be unavailable due to API key restrictions ('hourly_rate', 'cost_hourly_rate', 'currency').

not_billable.description: Flag. It's mean is project billable or not

estimated_days.description: Estimated Days. Depending on the estimated project units

get.description: Retrieves a paginated timesheet. According to the user access level, the timesheet may change

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Sort results by a specified field. Some data may be unavailable due to API key access restrictions (e.g., 'id', 'client_id', etc.).

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date for filtering records. Only records with dates equal to or later than this date will be included. The date format must be 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for filtering records. Only records with dates equal to or earlier than this date will be included. The date format must be 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Used to filter records belonging to a specific client by ID. Cannot be used together with clientName

parameters.name: lientName
parameters.description: Used to filter records belonging to a specific client by name. Cannot be used together with clientId

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Used to filter records belonging to a specific project by ID. Cannot be used together with projectName

parameters.name: projectName
parameters.description: Used to filter records belonging to a specific project by name. Cannot be used together with projectId

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Used to filter records belonging to a specific member by email. Cannot be used together with memberId

parameters.name: memberId
parameters.description: Used to filter records belonging to a specific member by ID. Cannot be used together with email

timer_started_at.description: Timer started at. Timer is running when this field is not null

post.description: Create a new time entry. Supports both single object and array of objects as input.

validationErrors.description: Object where keys are attribute names and values are error messages

415.description: Invalid Content-Type. This API only accepts requests with 'application/json'.

error.example: Invalid Content-Type. This API only accepts requests with 'application/json'.

401.description: Unauthorized request due to invalid credentials.

error.example: Your request could not be completed due to invalid credentials

page.name: page
page.description: The page number. Must be an integer greater than 0.

page_size.name: page_size
page_size.description: The number of items per page. Must be an integer greater than 0.

reverse.name: reverse
reverse.description: If set to 1, sorts the result in descending order.

company_alias.name: company_alias
company_alias.description: The the company alias (subdomain of the account).

client_id.name: client_id
client_id.description: The unique ID of the client.

task_id.name: task_id
task_id.description: The unique ID of the task.

project_id.name: project_id
project_id.description: The unique ID of the project.

timesheet_id.description: The unique ID of the time entry.
